body:
@tgamblin @alalazo @adamjstewart @davydden 

With the "new improved" permissions, we are now able to add labels to Issues and PR's.  GitHub provides the following labels:

> bug
> duplicate
> enhancement
> invalid
> needs-review
> needs-work
> question
> spec-change
> will-merge
> wontfix

They all seem reasonable; but maybe we can get rid of spec-change.  I propose we add some new labels as well:

**package**: This PR modifies only one or more `package.py` files, not core Spack
**new**: Add to **package**-labelled PR's to indicate it's a new package no previously in Spack.  (Do we need this?  Not sure)
**bugfix**: This PR aims to fix a known bug (bug Issue should be referenced in the PR)

Thoughts, anyone?  Apparently I can't add new labels, someone at LLNL would need to do that.
title: GitHub Labels
